item.title: Report E-2023110496
item.description:
Report E-2023110496

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-28T18:13:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-13
  • City: PARSIPPANY TROY HILLS
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 13, 2023, two (2) 275-gallon totes of UN3109 were defective and released approximately seventy-five (75) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE began to unload and remediate the impacted cargo. Crews transferred approximately 200 gallons of organic peroxide from the damaged tote into a new tote. Crews cut up the empty tote and added it to a 55-gallon drum for disposal. FCE replaced the cap on the tote missing its cap. All impacted pallets, cardboard, and debris were collected for disposal

item.title: Report E-2023110219
item.description:
Report E-2023110219

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-28T18:13:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-08
  • City: COLUMBUS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XCO experienced a release from (6) 65-pound UN2794, Batteries, Wet, Filled with Acid. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 6-gallons of battery acid released to a 4’ x 7’ area of the trailer floor due improper loading. Each damaged battery was placed into its own 55-gallon poly drum. A sodium bicarb solution was then utilized to clean the impacted trailer floor. All impacted absorbents, impacted pallet pieces, and PPE were placed into a seventh 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023110212
item.description:
Report E-2023110212

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-28T18:13:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-07
  • City: CHARLOTTE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: IT was reported a one-cup spill of UN3288 "ZINC CHROMATE CZ20" that arrived damaged at Terminal NCH. The caller stated that (1) a 55-pound paper bag was damaged due to freight impact as a result of a load shift impacting Trailer #321-6239. The contractor arrived and noted the material was spilled inside of the trailer and left a trail leading out onto the dock where the pallet containing the damaged bag was. The contractor was able to confirm the dock plate prevented any material from releasing onto the ground beneath the trailer. The pallet was restacked; the damaged bag and released material were placed into (1) 55-poly drum. The waste was left onsite for the terminal to manage.

  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UAD experienced a UN2924 M2488 release from a 55-gallon metal drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 0.5-gallons of product released to a 1’ x 1’ area of the trailer floor and pallet due to a faulty drum seam. The damaged drum was placed into an 85-gallon metal overpack. The impacted trailer floor was wiped down and cleaned with absorbents. The impacted absorbents, cut up impacted pallet, and PPE were containerized into a 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. : Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1 pound of product released to a 2’ x 2’ area of the trailer floor due to a forklift puncture. item.title: Report E-2023110122
item.description:
Report E-2023110122

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-28T18:13:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-03
  • City: KNOXVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics Terminal NKX experienced a UN2801 Keyazine Brown MO/LA Liquid release from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 3 ounces of product released to a 1’ x 1’ area of the tote body and trailer floor due to a loose cap. The cap was re-secured, and the impacted tote and trailer floor were wiped down and neutralized with a soda ash solution. A slosh test was conducted on the tote and verified the tote could be shipped on. The impacted rags were containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-03
  • City: WICHITA

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XWK experienced a UN1791 Dynachlor release from (4) 55-gallon poly drums. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 4-ounces of product released to a 1’ x 1’ area of the pallet and drums due to the vent caps releasing as a possible cause of temperature changes/drum expansion. The four drums in shipment and the impacted pallet were wiped down and neutralized with a vinegar solution. All caps were replaced, and the drums were secured for shipment on. All impacted rags, and the damaged caps were placed into a 10-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023110449
item.description:
Report E-2023110449

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-13
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 13, 2023, four (4) 55-pound bags of UN3378 were damaged and released approximately ten (10) pounds of product to the pallet and trailer floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. A HEPA-filtered drum vacuum was used to collect all freestanding product. The undamaged cargo was re-palletized for continued processing and shipping. The damaged bags were containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. The contents of the vacuum and all UN3378-impacted materials were collected and containerized in one (1) additional 55-gallon drum for disposal by R+L.

item.title: Report E-2023110448
item.description:
Report E-2023110448

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-10
  • City: MUSKOGEE
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 10, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN2920 was punctured in transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works, Inc. (EWI) to remediate the impacted site. EWI personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted-trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. EWI placed the damaged 55-gallon drum into one (1) 85-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2023110446
item.description:
Report E-2023110446

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-10
  • City: HATFIELD
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 10, 2023, one (1) 25-pound pail of UN2880 was crushed in transit and released approximately one (1) pound of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. ES personnel utilized hand tools to remediate the impacted trailer to the extent practicable. The damaged pail of calcium hypochlorite and all the released product was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon poly vented drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023110444
item.description:
Report E-2023110444

  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL

  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 10, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1139 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately twenty (20) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the release and swept them in utilizing hand tools. All impacted material was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023110323
item.description:
Report E-2023110323

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-08
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 8, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of paint was damaged by a faulty pallet and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the UN1263 paint-impacted trailer interior and swept them in with hand tools. The damaged 55-gallon drum was containerized into an 85-gallon over-pack. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 15-gallon drum, both for terminal disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023110321
item.description:
Report E-2023110321

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-06
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 6, 2023, two (2) 1-gallon pails of paint were crushed in transit and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. HES personnel deployed granular absorbents to the paint-impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbent, the damaged pails, and debris were collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums to be staged onsite for future disposal.

  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 6, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN1263 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. Personnel utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the paint- impacted trailer to the extent practicable. The damaged pail and all impacted debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum to be staged onsite for transport and disposal.

item.description:

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-02
  • City: LITTLE ROCK
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 2, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon jug of UN1824 was punctured and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the dock floor and pallet. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Mid-South Environmental Services (MSES) to remediate the impacted site. Crews deployed a neutralizing agent to the impacted area. MSES personnel then deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and worked them in using hand tools. Crews utilized absorbent pads to collect any residual product from the impacted areas. The empty 5-gallon jug, all spent absorbents, and any cleanup debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum and was staged onsite for future disposal.

R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Miller Environmental Group (MEG) to remediate the impacted site. Crews neutralized the impacted surfaces with a sprayer, soda ash solution, and absorbent pads, and they pH tested the surfaces to ensure they were sufficiently neutralized. MEG personnel placed the one (1) impacted 1-gallon pail, used absorbent pads, and any cleanup debris into one (1) 5-gallon bucket that was staged in the terminal's waste holding room.

item.description:

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-27
  • City: MCCAMMON
  • State: ID
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While in transit the driver stopped for a break and performed a load check and noticed a dark orangish liquid dripping for his trailer around 0930. The driver then put down some absorbent pads and a bucket to help mitigate the release. He then called in to report the release. We then dispatched a team to go out to the seen and start the clean up process. The team arrived on seen at approximately 1500 and dawned the proper PPE and began the clean up procedure. The drum had a small pinhole above the top chime that looks like it may have been rubbing against another container or pallet during transit. The drum was overpacked and all absorbent material was disposed of and transported for disposal per proper regulation.

Waste was left for the terminal to manage.

  • City: CAMDEN
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CONSOLIDATED RAIL CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 11, 2023 at 11:45 during a joint Mechanical inspection with FRA at the Conrail Pavonia Terminal PROX 280095 a residue tank car of acetone dripping from the bottom outlet valve of the tank car. Upon inspection it was found that the bottom outlet valve was partially open and the closure pin was not in place. The valve was closed and the pin was replaced in the retainer thus stopping the leak. Marion Environmental, an approved Conrail Contractor was notified to respond, inspect and secure the tank car. Marion personnel, removed the bottom outlet cap and drained the product below the valve. They also found both the liquid and vapor valve secondary plugs less than tool tight. Once the tank car was secured it was released to transportation. FRA Hazardous Material Inspector, Joe Bowen made notifications to both the Shipper and Consignee of the incident. Cause Code: 2 x ( 4 + 3 + 0 ) x ( 2+ 0 ) = 28

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-23
  • City: ROMEOVILLE

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: ROADRUNNER TRANSPORTATION SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 23, 2023, at 1418 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Roadrunner Transportation Systems personnel in Romeoville, Illinois regarding the damage of approximately (1) 55-gallon drum containing Ethyl Methacrylate (UN2277, 3, II). Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed (1) 55-gallon drum containing Ethyl Methacrylate (UN2277, 3, II) was punctured, with NO release seen. They were able to transfer the contents of the drum into a new 65-gallon poly overpack without complication. The 65-gallon poly overpack containerized waste was staged onsite in preparation for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023110060
item.description:
Report E-2023110060

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-28T18:13:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-18
  • City: TARRANT
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN EARTH SPECIALTY WASTE SOLUTIONS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The tanker had been picked up from a 3rd party tanker cleaning company. The investigation revealed that during the cleanout the 3rd party had removed the cleanout port cap on top of the tanker and didn't fully secure the cap once the tanker was cleaned out. The tanker was then sent to pickup a load at PPG Industries, the driver only checked the top hatch and hose valves after loading. Upon leaving the shipping facility the driver stopped at a scale 40 miles away, there was no evidence at this time of any release. Upon reaching his final destination he noticed material had sprayed out of the top of the tanker from the top of the tanker from the cleanout port. The cap was still affixed but he was able to hand tighten it. Based upon scale tickets from the beginning and end of his trip we were able to determine the amount that had released 45lbs = 5 gallons. The tanker showed signs of the material spraying onto the top portion of tanker.

  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XCF experienced a customer location release of UN2693 Sodium Bisulfite Solution 40% from (3) 275-gallon poly totes. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of product released to a 10’ x 30’ area of the trailer and concrete lot below. The release occurred due to high temps expanding the totes/loose caps as well as small puncture holes in the tote bodies. The material in the three totes were transferred into new totes. Soda ash was utilized to neutralize the release & absorbents were then deployed to clean all released product. All impacted absorbents were containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The damaged totes were then cut up and containerized into (4) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was removed from site pending disposal.

  • Description: Responded to report of Nitric acid leak from tank car GATX220384 in Brosnan Yard Macon GA. Upon inspection by a contractor, the leak was coming from the liquid line valve. The liquid line valve was in closed position but product was leaking past the valve and the secondary closure cam lock cap. The cam Lock cap was missing a gasket. A gasket was installed for the cap and 4psi of pressure was scrubbed off of the tank car. The leak was stopped. The car will be held pending transfer of load.

  • Description: Norfolk Southern personnel reported tank car GATX73831 leaking from the top of the car. Upon inspection by a contractor, the leak was found to be from the liquid valve blind flange. The leak resulted from a defective blind flange gasket and product leaking past the closed liquid line valve. A new blind flange gasket was installed and the leak stopped. The shipper was notified and is arranging for a certified mobile shop to replace the valve.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A fiberboard box with signs of release was found during sort operations at the Memphis hub. The fiberboard box contained a plastic jerrycan inside. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

  • City: HATFIELD
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 27, 2023, one (1) 30-gallon drum of UN3265 was punctured by a faulty skid and released approximately six (6) ounces of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel overpacked the damaged 30-gallon drum in one (1) 55-gallon drum. The crew deployed soda ash to the released material and swept them in using hand tools. All impacted material was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pkg. was received damaged. Pkg. had liquid leaking from bottom of box, taken to QA for inspection. DescribePack: Upon inspecting pkg., it was noted that there were 2, 1 gallon containers of Corrosive material, pkg. was not declared a Hazmat by shipper. There were no labels, orientation arrows, hazmat shipping paper work of any type. We noticed it was a Hazmat by looking at the container, has Corrosive label on it. Cans were stacked on top of each other in box, just brown paper to protect contents. We searched to see if shipper was an Authorized Shipper, they are not. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: Pkg. sitting in bin in HMPA awaiting instructions from PGH. Will reach out to customer to see if they are willing to pick up the undamaged container.
